column4: I am having the same problem gartral, they changed something in 10.04 to make it stop auto detecting svideo
for some reason xrandr isn't working for me
SMEG! i wish my tv had hdmi
I tried "xrandr --addmode S-video 800x600"
get this: WINE plays gmod and all my source games except L4d2.. and hulu run perfectly side by by side.. with compiz open.. and i cant use my tv ;_;
but it said "warning: output S-video not found; ignoring
X Error of failed request:  BadRROutput (invalid Output parameter)
Major opcode of failed request:  149 (RANDR)
Minor opcode of failed request:  15 (RRGetOutputProperty)
Serial number of failed request:  26
Current serial number in output stream:  26
So anyone know how to fix?
son of a...
aparently for the svideo probelms
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1477286
recompile kernal
Is your laptop using Windows currently ElementalWarrior?
http://wubi-installer.org/
http://wubi-installer.org/ Does that help?
Wubi lets you install x/k/ubuntu inside of windows, without having to repartition any drives
recompiling the kernel isnt supported by ubuntu
bah, then there is no solution???
LTS my ass~
you can do it.. but the ubuntu guys dont like supporting it
